title: Electrical Lead Engineer
description_html:
As electrical lead engineer, you will be a technical professional who provides engineering leadership for a team of engineers and technicians. You will provide mentorship and guidance to junior engineers, as well as contribute to the design and development of new products and features by managing team workloads and monitoring requirements, working closely with lead engineers of other disciplines and project management teams. You will work with customers and suppliers to bring products to qualification on time and within budget. As electrical lead engineer, you must also ensure that engineering processes are followed to generate and maintain product quality. The electrical lead engineer will manage a team of four to eight engineers and technicians and report to the Head of Design.


Duties: 


•    Providing technical direction and engineering leadership for a team of engineers

•    Mentoring and guiding junior engineers

•    Contributing to the design and development of new products and features

•    Ensuring that engineering processes are followed

•    Maintaining product quality

•    Contribute to the continuing improvement of processes and procedures

•    Work with other technical leads and project teams to meet requirements on time and within budget


Skills/Qualifications: 

•    A bachelor’s degree in electrical engineering or a related field

•    Strong understanding of engineering principles and processes

•    Ability to mentor and guide junior engineers

•    Strong technical and problem-solving skills

•    Excellent communication and interpersonal skills

•    The ability to work effectively in a team environment

•    Experience or working with customers and suppliers

•    Good time management

•    Strong 3D modelling and simulation skills

•    Knowledge of a breadth of standards and an understanding of what is involved in achieving them

•    A flexible approach to work and a desire to learn and incorporate novel engineering techniques into design solutions

•    Please be aware that many roles working for STS Defence will be subject to both security and export control restrictions. These restrictions mean that factors including your nationality, any previous nationalities you have held, and your place of birth may limit those roles you can perform for the organisation.

Desirable

•    Experience of AutoDesk Inventor and related products

•    Experience of AutoCAD electrical & Altium design software

•    Previous leadership experience

•    Knowledge of environmental, shock and vibration testing requirements and how to meet them

•    Experience of working systems engineering and the engineering ‘V’ model

•    Defence and/or Aerospace sector experience preferred 

•    Working knowledge of ISO9001/ AS9100 business management system

•    Commitment to quality

•    Open and collaborative style where ideas are shared and challenged

•    Eligible for UK security clearances

title: Configuration Engineer
description_html:
The Configuration Engineer will provide a key supporting function within the Design Engineering department, for configuration and change management, principally using the Autodesk Vault Product Data Management (PDM) tool. This holds data from individual CAD drawings, electronics schematics, through to full-scale assemblies for complete products and sub-systems. They will also be responsible for facilitating Engineering change reviews via the Change Control Board process

This role will be the gatekeeper for the control and revision state of engineering designs and supporting documents. They will also be the facilitator for all internal reviews of design and proposed changes. 

Typical projects reside within the naval or aerospace environment, for prime contractors and Tier one suppliers. This role requires strong prior experience of using and managing PDM software tools and the processes for the management and change of data across design/product life-cycles, including the interface between design & development and production engineering.

Through the Design Engineering department, this role will contribute to successful operation of the organisation and its adherence to the business management system, including integration of the PDM and other software tools to support improved configuration management and release control of sensitive data. This therefore requires the appropriate security clearances.



Duties: 

•    Manage configuration control and storage of controlled documents/ designs using the Autodesk Vault PDM tool, covering a range of data types from mechanical CAD drawings, electronics design schematics, and supporting deliverable documents.

•    Creation and maintenance of digital infrastructure and maintenance of component & part libraries within Autodesk Vault PDM tool.

•    Creation and maintenance of new project file properties and metadata within Autodesk Vault PDM tool

•    Manage release control of design data across the development lifecycles; from initial concept, through to the establishment of configuration baselines during key design reviews. 

•    Manage the engineering change process, and all reviews and approvals needed for compliance and success. 

•    Work closely with internal stakeholders to further develop the Autodesk Vault PDM and other supporting tools as an integrated Configuration Management System, to meet the needs of Design, Development and Systems Integration projects

•    Support the development of improved business system linkages, for example export/automation of data transfer from the PDM tool to Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP) tools

•    Support annual review of processes for design/product lifecycle management, aligned to relevant Quality and Defence Standards


Skills/Qualifications: 

•    Clear understanding and experience of setting up/use of PDM tools for configuration control of design data and technical documentation

•    An engineering background and competency with IT systems

•    Experience of technical library environment, or drawing office environment

•    Experience of working in a technically regulated engineering industry (defence, aerospace, medical, nuclear for example)

•    Working knowledge of ISO9001/ AS9100 business management system

•    Commitment to quality

•    Open and collaborative style where ideas are shared and challenged

•    Eligible for UK security clearances

title: Production Planner
description_html:
To own and control the day-to-day production schedule, ensuring efficient execution of the production plan, strong schedule adherence, and clear communication across Planning, Production, Operations, and Programmes. The role separates short-term execution from medium- and long-term planning to improve operational performance, stability, and scalability. 


Key duties:  

•    Own full accountability for the production schedule from work order release through to completion

•    Create, maintain, and communicate the Weekly Work Schedule

•    Sequence and prioritise work orders in line with capacity, material availability, and business priorities

•    Proactively manage and adjust schedules to minimise disruption and delays

•    Raise, print, and distribute work orders and job packs on a weekly basis

•    Maintain the Ready-to-Release work order process

•    Ensure accuracy, completeness, and timeliness of all production documentation

•    Act as the primary point of contact for production scheduling queries and changes

•    Communicate priorities, constraints, and schedule changes clearly to stakeholders

•    Work closely with Production Planners to align short-term execution with agreed plans

•    Engage regularly with Production, Operations, Quality, and Programmes teams

•    Identify scheduling inefficiencies and recurring execution issues

•    Contribute to improvements in schedule adherence, delivery performance, and production stability

•    Provide accurate scheduling data to support reporting and operational decision-making

     Skills/Qualifications:


Essential

•    Demonstrable experience in production planning, scheduling, or a similar role within a manufacturing environment

•    Strong knowledge of production processes, inventory management, and Material Requirements Planning (MRP) systems

•    Good understanding of MRP methodology and its application in a manufacturing setting

•    Proficiency in ERP systems (e.g. 123Insight, SAP, Oracle) and Microsoft Office, particularly Excel

•    Excellent organisational and problem-solving skills with strong attention to detail

•    Ability to work under pressure and manage multiple tasks in a fast-paced environment

•    Strong communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to collaborate effectively across diverse teams

Desirable

•    Experience in electronics manufacturing or complex assembly environments

•    Knowledge of Lean manufacturing principles and/or Six Sigma methodologies

•    Understanding of continuous improvement tools and techniques

•    Exposure to SIOP, capacity planning, or MRP improvement initiatives

title: Production Operative PCBA
description_html:
The Production Operative will possess a strong manufacturing and assembly background, ideally gained within the Aerospace and Defence sector or another low to medium volume Technology sector. The role is to ensure that the assembly of products are carried out to the required Quality, Cost and Delivery requirements. 


Key areas of responsibility include:

•    Prepare and assemble units / PCB’s (including soldering, over moulding, wiring, cable and harness ) in accordance with detailed work instruction sheets, customer specific drawings and specifications.

•    Read and interpret complex CCA drawings, including systems and notes.

•    Verify that routings and detailed Work Instruction Sheets have been followed for all activities.

•    Adhere to the Company’s quality operating procedures at all times during the execution of day to day assembly activities, complying with IPC-A-620, IPC-A-610, J-STD-001, AS9100 and NADCAP procedures where required.

•    Ensure compliance to the Company’s Health and Safety and Environmental procedures. 

•    Become proficient in the procedures and processes relevant to the position and to highlight training needs when required.

•    Act at all times in accordance with the terms and conditions described in the Employee’s contract of employment.

•    Apply a professional and conscious approach in your day to day operations.

•    Engage in 5s activities as required by local supervision and other Lean events when required to do so.

•    Carry out any other duties commensurate with your skills.



Skills/Qualifications:

•    Proven and demonstrable experience of working within electronic assembly / PCB operations, ideally within the defence or aerospace sector.

•    A good understanding of Health and Safety Management within an engineering / manufacturing environment.

•    The ability to demonstrate attention to detail and produce a high standard of work, apply a ‘right first time’ approach.

•    Ideally qualified to IPC and JSTD soldering standards. Can operate to IPC class 3 standards

•    Willingness and desire to learn new skills and invest in professional development. 

•    Excellent communications skills with proven experience of engaging and building relationships within a team


Desirable:

•    Experience in a fast paced Aerospace or Defence Quality manufacturing environment desirable.

•    Trained in IPC-A-620, IPC-A-610, J-STD-001, valid certification preferred

title: Weld Fabricator
description_html:
STS Defence is seeking an experienced Weld Fabricator with strong TIG and MIG welding expertise to join its skilled production team. This is a long-term opportunity within a high-precision defence manufacturing environment, producing detailed and safety-critical components to exacting standards.

The successful candidate will be responsible for precision welding and fabrication of ferrous and non-ferrous materials, working closely to engineering drawings, routings, and inspection processes.


Key duties:  


•    Perform high-quality TIG and MIG welding on ferrous and non-ferrous materials

•    Manufacture precision defence components to tight tolerances

•    Work to engineering drawings, specifications, and ISO standards

•    Carry out fabrication, finishing, and preparation activities using grinders, linishers, and hand tools

•    Follow defined routing and inspection processes to ensure compliance

•    Maintain high standards of workmanship, quality, and traceability

•    Sign off completed work using an individual quality “stamp”

•    Contribute proactively to continuous improvement and problem-solving within the team


Skills/Qualifications:


•    Proven TIG welding experience within Defence, Aerospace, Motorsport, or Nuclear environments

•    Strong background in aluminium welding to ISO or equivalent standards

•    Experience working in fabrication and precision manufacturing environments

•    Ability to read and interpret complex engineering drawings

•    High attention to detail with a strong quality-focused mindset

•    Experience using grinders, linishers, and general fabrication hand tools

•    Familiarity with routing, inspection, and quality assurance processes

•    Team-oriented approach with strong communication and problem-solving skills

•    Willingness and capability to maintain a personal quality stamp

description_html:
The Production Operative will possess a strong manufacturing and assembly background, ideally gained within the Aerospace and Defence sector or another low to medium volume Technology sector. Early: Mon-Thursday 6:00-2:00.  Friday 6:00 – 13:30

title: Surface Mount Solderer
description_html:
Are you skilled in soldering and passionate about producing high-quality work? Join our friendly and professional Auto Assembly team, where precision and teamwork come together to deliver excellence. We’re looking for a detail-oriented individual with experience in electronic assembly, soldering to IPC Class 3 standards. This individual will be working as part of a team in Auto assembly and mainly responsible for re-working a combination of SMT and through hole components.  

Main Duties:

 

  • Rework SMT and PTH components using a variety of equipment and techniques such as hot air pencil and back heaters
  • Interacting with automatic inspection systems such as AOI/X-ray  
  • Follow detailed assembly instructions and build standards to ensure accuracy and consistency.
  • Complete traceability paperwork including batch records, build reports, and logs.
  • Maintain soldering tools and equipment, including microscopes and soldering irons.
  • Ensure compliance with IPC 610 standards, ESD requirements, and Health & Safety guidelines.
  • Collaborate with team members to meet weekly production targets.
  • Attend team meetings and contribute ideas to improve processes and efficiency.
  • Work flexibly and proactively to support production and quality goals.

 

 

Person Specification

  • Minimum 12 months experience in soldering electronic printed circuit boards; IPC 610 or J-STD. Preferably with SMT or PTH rework experience.
  • Experience of working with a microscope due to size of componentry.
  • Strong hand-eye coordination and attention to detail.
  • Good understanding of English, both verbal and written.
  • Professional attitude with strong communication and interpersonal skills.
  • Able to work independently and as part of a team.
  • Basic computer skills (Microsoft Office, quality databases).

 

At Axis we expect every employee to commit to our Teamship Rules:

  • Caring: for each other, our customers, our suppliers and all other stakeholders
  • Hardworking: with diligence, creativity, and by going the extra mile
  • Integrity: through honesty with oneself and with others
  • Positivity: a can-do attitude
  • Synergy: a united front as team Axis

title: ILS Manager
description_html:
The Integrated Logistic Support (ILS) Manager is responsible for the successful delivery and coordination of all ILS aspects of Programmes.  This includes the formulation of ILS strategies, production of ILS processes/procedures/plans and associated documents, as well as monitoring of ILS performance, trend/KPI reporting and production of regular reports with recommendations for the customer.

Although reporting to the Head of Communication Programmes, the role is responsible for ILS aspects of all Programmes contracts as well as ensuring consistency of approach across everything we do and upholding the ‘STS approach’ to ILS delivery.  This position is crucial for creating and maintaining focus, enthusiasm and momentum, ensuring the overall integrity and coherence of ILS activities for Programmes.  This extends to the development, maintenance and support/oversight of each team.

As a secondary, supporting role, the ILS Manager will help to support the Heads of Programmes with resource planning, qualification tracking, personal development, management of interdependencies and oversight of risks and issues. The role also includes the coordination of new skills and continuous improvement to enable effective change and realisation of programme benefits. 

Duties: The ILS Manager is responsible for:

•    Planning and maintaining an effective support regime, proactively monitoring its progress, resolving issues and initiating appropriate corrective action. 

•    Formulating ILS strategies and approaches for all contracts

•    Acting as the ILS expert within STS Defence and upholding end user requirements across our organisation

•    Documenting all ILS plans, procedures and processes and ensuring consistency across all Programmes contracts

•    Auditing and monitoring the effectiveness of all plans

•    Monitoring ILS performance, trends and KPIs and reporting to Heads of Programmes and Project Managers

•    Liaising closely (and leading the way) with Logistics and Procurement departments for information and data production

•    Producing regular and timely reports for customers on ILS performance and proactive recommendations that help mitigate future programme/contract risks

•    Recommending improvement plans and change activities that benefit STS Defence and/or customers, paying particular attention to end users of capability that we deliver

•    Ensuring effective quality assurance around project delivery – focussing on Suitably Qualified Experienced Personnel (SQEP) consistency for Programmes, alignment with STS Defence strategy and outwardly on its coherence with customer expectation and specialist standards

•    Facilitating the assignment of individuals to Integrated Project Teams for complex projects

•    Ensuring the maintenance of sufficient resources and skills for programme activities and the effective allocation of required skills to individual projects

•    Managing communications with all internal and relevant external stakeholders

•    Managing the SQEP dependencies and interfaces between projects

•    Initiate training, skills development 

•    Reporting the progress of the support regime at regular intervals to the Programmes Director and Managing Director, as directed

•    Proactive identification and exploitation of all new business development opportunities that emerge through ILS development and customer interaction


Skills/Qualifications: The ILS Manager should have:

•    Effective leadership, management, interpersonal and communications skills

•    The ability to command respect and to create a sense of community across all teams

•    Subject matter expertise in military ILS process and requirements

•    Preferably a background in maintenance of RN communications and/or IT systems

•    Good knowledge of the techniques for planning, monitoring and controlling personnel

•    Sound business case development and approvals skills

•    Good understanding of recruitment, personnel development processes and negotiation with third parties

•    An understanding of programme and project management methods such as MSP, PRINCE2, APM, Change Management and MoR.

•    Good knowledge of budgetary and resource allocation procedures

title: Production Team Leader
description_html:
The Production Supervisor is responsible for leading and supporting a high-flow production value stream to deliver agreed production plans safely, on time, to cost, and to defined quality standards. The role ensures effective day-to-day supervision of production teams, adherence to standard processes, and compliance with health, safety, environmental, quality, and defence industry requirements. The post holder will focus on operational control, people supervision, and performance against plan.

Key duties:  

•    Supervise and support production team members to ensure work is completed to customer specification, schedule, and budget, while complying with all health, safety, environmental, and security requirements.

•    Plan, prioritise, and allocate work to meet daily production targets, adjusting priorities as required to maintain flow and on-time delivery.

•    Ensure tools, equipment, and resources are available, capable, and maintained to support production requirements.

•    Lead and support daily tier meetings, ensuring tier boards, KPIs, and visual management systems are maintained and accurately reflect current performance.

•    Monitor performance against plan, identifying variances to standard times, quality, or output, and escalate issues where required.

•    Support structured problem-solving activities (e.g. 5 Why, 8D) for non-conformances and performance issues, ensuring actions are implemented and sustained.

•    Ensure production activities are carried out in accordance with defined standard work, takt time and flow requirements.

•    Maintain 5S standards and visual management systems in line with company requirements.

•    Manage day-to-day people matters including attendance, timekeeping, discipline, engagement, and employee relations, escalating issues where appropriate.

•    Support delivery of training plans and ensure team members are competent and authorised to perform assigned tasks.

•    Promote effective communication, teamwork, and a positive working environment.

•    Ensure Total Productive Maintenance (TPM) activities are completed and recorded in line with schedule.

•    Liaise with internal functions such as Supply Chain, Engineering, Quality Assurance, and Planning to ensure production is completed to plan and to specification.

•    Ensure all activities are conducted in accordance with company policies, defence manufacturing regulations, quality standards, and security requirements.

  Skills/Qualifications:

•    Experience in a flow-line or high-volume manufacturing environment.

•    Minimum of 1 years’ experience leading or supervising production teams.

•    Working knowledge of Lean Manufacturing principles and standard work application.

•    Experience with visual management and performance tracking.

•    Experience using ERP/MRP systems and production planning tools.

•    Competent user of Microsoft Office (Excel, Word, PowerPoint).

title: Head of Communications Programmes
description_html:
The Head of Communications Programmes is a senior leadership role responsible for the successful delivery of a portfolio of secure communications projects for STS Defence. This includes oversight of RF, data, encrypted systems, and advanced secure communication technologies across multiple programmes.

The postholder will lead a multi-disciplinary programme organisation, ensuring delivery excellence, strict adherence to security and accreditation requirements, and alignment with STS Defence’s strategic objectives. Reporting directly to the Programmes Director, the Head of Communications Programmes will shape programme strategy, drive operational performance, and maintain strong relationships with a diverse customer base—ranging from the Ministry of Defence (MoD) and wider defence sector organisations to civil contractors and commercial partners. The role ensures all projects are delivered to the highest technical, commercial, and security standards.

This role also includes acting as a senior escalation point for the STS Defence Service Desk and will require occasional out-of-hours support to manage critical issues, maintain service continuity, and ensure rapid response to high-priority incidents. The postholder ensures all projects and services are delivered to the highest technical, commercial, and security standards.

Key Responsibilities

•    Provide leadership and oversight for a portfolio of secure communications programmes, including RF and data-centric systems.

•    Manage, mentor, and develop a team of project managers, ensuring high performance, effective resource allocation, and successful project delivery.

•    Drive programme planning, execution, tracking, and reporting in alignment with MoD requirements and internal governance processes.

•    Act as the primary escalation point for programme-level risks, issues, and dependencies, ensuring mitigation plans are implemented.

•    Engage directly with MoD stakeholders, industry partners, and internal technical teams to ensure clear communication and alignment of objectives.

•    Ensure compliance with all security policies, accreditation requirements, and government-mandated protocols for classified projects.

•    Manage programme budgets, schedules, commercial obligations, and performance metrics to ensure delivery within agreed parameters.

•    Oversee the integration of new technologies, engineering changes, and system upgrades across programme phases.

•    Support bid activity, proposal development, and strategic planning for future secure communications programmes.

•    Promote a culture of safety, security, continuous improvement, and high-quality delivery across all programme teams.

Skills and Qualifications

•    Proven experience in delivering complex defence, secure communications, RF, or data-based programmes.

•    Strong leadership skills with the ability to manage and inspire multiple project managers in a high-pressure environment.

•    Exceptional stakeholder management skills, with experience interfacing at senior levels within the MoD or equivalent defence organisations.

•    Strong understanding of RF systems, secure communication technologies, and/or classified data networks.

•    Demonstrable experience in programme governance, risk management, cost control, and schedule management.

•    Excellent communication, negotiation, and decision-making skills.

•    Ability to operate effectively within a highly regulated, security-sensitive environment.

•    Solid understanding of defence contracting, engineering lifecycle processes, and systems integration.

Essential

•    Extensive experience in defence sector programme management, ideally within secure communications or related systems.

•    Demonstrated ability to oversee multiple complex projects simultaneously.

•    Experience managing geographically dispersed or multi-disciplinary teams.

•    Eligibility for, and willingness to maintain, high-level UK security clearance (DV preferred / mandatory).

•    Strong commercial acumen and understanding of MoD procurement frameworks.

•    Degree in Engineering, Communications Technology, Defence Studies, Programme Management, or a related technical discipline (or equivalent experience).

•    Professional project or programme management certification (e.g., APM, MSP, PRINCE2) preferred

title: -	Power BI - Data Specialist
description_html:
Power BI - Data Specialist

Cicor Romania is hiring a Data Specialist with experience in Power BI, capable of developing interactive dashboards, optimizing data models and providing analytical support to business teams. If you have analytical thinking, attention to detail and passion for data, we are waiting for you in our team.

 

Key Responsibilities:

  • Develop, maintain, and optimize interactive Power BI dashboards and reports.
  • Collaborate with business stakeholders to gather requirements and translate them into technical solutions.
  • Design and maintain data models, schemas, and warehouse architectures to support BI solutions.
  • Write and optimize SQL queries, stored procedures, and backend scripts to support BI reporting needs.
  • Support ETL processes, ensuring proper data integration, transformation, and quality.
  • Assist in integrating Power BI with other systems and data sources, including APIs and cloud platforms.
  • Ensure optimal performance of reports and dashboards by analyzing and optimizing backend queries, data refreshes, and model structures.
  • Document data flows, architecture diagrams, report designs, and backend processes for team reference and auditing.
  • Understand and work with relational databases, data lakes, and data warehouses for accurate reporting.
  • Implement data architecture best practices, including dimensional modeling, star/snowflake schemas, and fact/dimension tables.
  • Implement data governance, security, and compliance measures.

 

Required Skills & Qualifications:

  • Experience: 5+ years in a similar position
  • Proven experience as a Power BI Developer or similar BI role.
  • Understanding data visualization best practices and performance optimization in Power BI.
  • Experience with data architecture design: dimensional modeling, star/snowflake schemas, fact/dimension tables.
  • Familiarity with ETL processes, data warehousing, and API integrations.
  • Experience with data transformation tools (e.g., Power Query, SSIS, Azure Data Factory).
  • Experience with cloud platforms (Azure) for BI and data architecture solutions.
  • Knowledge of Python, R, or other scripting languages for analytics and automation.
  • Analytical mindset with problem-solving capabilities.
  • Excellent communication skills to interact with both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
  • Excellent command in English (written and verbal)
  • Ability to work independently and collaboratively.
  • Strong organizational skills and ability to manage multiple tasks/projects.
  • Attention to detail and high data accuracy.

 

 

 Nice to have Skills & Qualifications

  • Strong knowledge of backend systems and database architecture, including relational and cloud-based databases.
  • Proficiency in SQL, DAX, and data modeling concepts.
  • Familiarity with Agile/Scrum methodology.
  • Experience with version control systems (e.g., Git).
  • Knowledge of data governance frameworks and data quality monitoring.
  • Strong understanding of end-to-end data flows: from source systems to BI consumption.
  • Ability to design scalable, maintainable, and high-performance BI solutions.
  • Passion for learning new technologies and BI best practices.

title: Manager de Proiect IT
description_html:
🔍 Descriere generală a postului:

Căutăm un Manager de Proiect IT versatil, cu experiență practică în administrarea sistemelor și rețelelor. Acest rol este ideal pentru o persoană care dorește să coordoneze și să livreze proiecte IT, dar care poate contribui activ și la activitățile zilnice de administrare a infrastructurii. Vei fi responsabil de planificarea și implementarea proiectelor tehnologice, de suportul tehnic de bază, precum și de coordonarea unei echipe tehnice în scopul livrării eficiente a soluțiilor IT.

🛠️ Responsabilități principale:

  • Planifică, coordonează și livrează proiecte IT, precum upgrade-uri de sistem, implementări software, extinderea infrastructurii de rețea.
  • Definește obiectivele proiectului, termenele limită și livrabilele; gestionează riscurile și dependențele.
  • Urmărește progresul proiectului utilizând instrumente specifice de project 
  • Menține documentația proiectelor și comunică în mod regulat statusul către Superiori.
  • Coordonează testarea, lansarea și predarea proiectului către echipele de suport.
  • Coordonează activitatea membrilor echipei implicate în proiect (ex: administratori de sistem, specialiști rețea, dezvoltatori, suport tehnic).
  • Alocă sarcini clare și stabilește priorități în funcție de fazele proiectului.
  • Organizează întâlniri operative zilnice sau săptămânale pentru alinierea echipei și urmărirea progresului.
  • Asigură un flux eficient de comunicare între membrii echipei și între echipă și alte departamente (ex: achiziții, HR, management).
  • Exemplu: În cadrul unui proiect de migrare a serverelor, vei gestiona task-urile tehnice ale administratorului de sistem (ex: configurare VM, back-up), specialistului de rețea (configurare VPN securizat), și vei colabora cu dezvoltatorii pentru compatibilitate aplicații.
  • Gestionează, monitorizează și întreține servere Windows și/sau Linux, inclusiv mașini virtuale.
  • Realizează actualizări de sistem, backup-uri regulate și aplică patch-uri de securitate.
  • Administrează Active Directory, politici de grup (Group Policy), și conturi de utilizatori.
  • Asigură funcționarea stabilă a serviciilor IT interne (ex: imprimare, acces fișiere, partajare resurse).
  • Asigură suport de bază pentru echipamente de rețea (switch-uri, routere, firewall-uri).
  • Gestionează configurări pentru VPN, DNS, DHCP și alte servicii de infrastructură.
  • Monitorizează performanța rețelei și intervine în caz de probleme de conectivitate.
  • Contribuie la implementarea politicilor de securitate a rețelei (acces, firewall, segmentare rețea).

✅ Cerințe minime:

  • Diplomă universitară în domeniul IT, Informatică sau experiență profesională echivalentă.
  • Minimum 2 ani experiență în gestionarea proiectelor IT.
  • Minimum 5 ani experiență în administrare de sistem și/sau rețea.
  • Cunoștințe practice de Windows Server, Active Directory, DNS, DHCP, VPN și infrastructură IT.
  • Abilități de utilizare a instrumentelor de project management 

💡 Cerințe preferate:

  • Experiență cu medii Office 365, sau platforme de virtualizare (VMware, Hyper-V).
  • Experiență în coordonarea echipelor tehnice și lucrul interdepartamental.

? Competențe cheie:

  • Abilități puternice de organizare, planificare și coordonare.
  • Comunicare eficientă, clară și profesionistă cu colegii.
  • Capacitatea de a rezolva probleme tehnice și organizaționale într-un mod structurat.
  • Spirit de echipă, dar și autonomie în luarea deciziilor.
  • Adaptabilitate în medii dinamice și multi-proiect.

Manager de Proiect IT
versatil, cu experiență practică în administrarea sistemelor și rețelelor. Vei fi responsabil de planificarea și implementarea proiectelor tehnologice, de suportul tehnic de bază, precum și de coordonarea unei echipe tehnice în scopul livrării eficiente a soluțiilor IT.

Asigură un flux eficient de comunicare între membrii echipei și între echipă și alte departamente (ex: achiziții, HR, management).

title: Inginer Senior IT
description_html:
🔍 Descriere generală a postului:

Căutăm Ingineer Senior IT, competent și proactiv, pentru a gestiona și sprijini infrastructura IT a organizației, incluzând servere, rețele, sisteme ale utilizatorilor și protocoale de securitate. Acest rol  este esențial pentru asigurarea fiabilității, securității și performanței sistemelor și conectivității interne. Vei fi responsabil pentru mentenanța serverelor fizice și virtuale, suportul pentru utilizatori, gestionarea echipamentelor de rețea și asigurarea funcționării optime a întregii infrastructuri IT.

🛠️ Responsabilități principale:

🔧 Administrare Sistem:

  • Instalarea, configurarea și întreținerea serverelor Windows și/sau Linux (fizice și virtuale).
  • Gestionarea Active Directory, politicilor de grup, serviciilor de fișiere/imprimare și a backup-urilor.
  • Monitorizarea performanței sistemului și rezolvarea problemelor hardware/software.
  • Aplicarea actualizărilor de sistem, firmware și configurații de securitate.
  • Monitorizarea și administrarea platformelor de virtualizare (ex: VMware, Hyper-V).

🌐 Administrare Rețea:

  • Instalarea, configurarea și întreținerea infrastructurii de rețea: routere, switch-uri, firewall-uri și puncte de acces wireless.
  • Monitorizarea performanței rețelei și rezolvarea problemelor de conectivitate.
  • Implementarea și mentenanța serviciilor VPN, VLAN, DNS, DHCP și alte servicii de rețea.
  • Asigurarea securității rețelei prin firewall-uri, antivirus și sisteme de detectare a intruziunilor (IDS).
  • Administrarea serviciilor de internet și intranet.

🔒 Securitate & Conformitate:

  • Implementarea și întreținerea celor mai bune practici de securitate pentru sisteme și rețele.
  • Realizarea de audituri periodice și evaluări de vulnerabilitate.
  • Gestionarea procedurilor de backup și recuperare în caz de dezastru.
  • Asigurarea conformității cu politicile companiei și cerințele legale (ex: GDPR, HIPAA).

👥 Suport pentru utilizatori & Documentare:

  • Oferirea de suport tehnic de nivel 1/2/3 pentru problemele escaladate.
  • Crearea și menținerea documentației detaliate pentru sisteme, rețele și proceduri.
  • Instruirea angajaților cu privire la bune practici și politici IT.

✅ Cerințe obligatorii:

  • Diplomă de licență în Informatică, Tehnologia Informației sau domenii similare (sau experiență echivalentă).
  • Minimum 5 ani de experiență în administrare de sistem și/sau rețea.
  • Cunoștințe solide despre Windows Server, Active Directory, DNS, DHCP și sisteme de fișiere.
  • Înțelegerea bună a TCP/IP, rutare, switching și configurarea firewall-urilor.
  • Experiență cu platforme de virtualizare (VMware, Hyper-V) și soluții de backup.
  • Familiaritate cu unelte de monitorizare a rețelei (ex: SolarWinds).
  • Înțelegerea principiilor și practicilor de securitate IT.

💡 Cerințe preferate:

  • Certificări de specialitate precum: CompTIA Network+, Security+, Microsoft (MCSA/MCSE), Cisco (CCNA), VMware (VCP).
  • Cunoștințe de scripting (PowerShell, Bash) pentru automatizări.

? Abilități cheie:

  • Abilități puternice de diagnosticare și rezolvare a problemelor.
  • Abilități excelente de comunicare și documentare.
  • Capacitatea de a gestiona mai multe priorități și proiecte simultan.
  • Spirit de echipă și atitudine proactivă, orientată către client.

title: Engineering Technician
description_html:
The Engineer Technician will undertake the electrical/mechanical fitting of a broad range of electrical equipment, predominantly to maritime platforms and MOD establishments, within the UK and abroad. Fitting must be presented for Installation Inspection, in line with detailed Installation Solution Guidance packages, and in accordance with relevant Joint Service Publications and Defence Standards.  


Duties: The Engineering Technician is responsible for:

•    the provision of skilled and generic electrical and/or mechanical fitting work, as directed by the Team Leader;

•    maintaining an awareness of the Time, Cost and Quality criteria of the task in hand;

•    working as a Team member, proactively and efficiently contributing to the main effort;

•    progression through personal continuous improvement, undertaking training as required to improve and sustain high skill levels;

•    Ensuring availability for working onsite and offsite, sometimes abroad to CONDO areas. This includes occasional overtime and weekend working; 

•    Working as directed within other STS Defence departments, providing support where priorities demand.


Skills/Qualifications: The Engineering Technician should have:

•    proven experience of electrical and mechanical installation;

•    a working knowledge of the Health and Safety Act 1974;

•    strong communication and organisational skills;

•    the ability to work unsupervised, demonstrate initiative, and be comfortable in a team environment;

•    an in-date Passport and category B driving licence;

•    current, relevant electrical qualification and certification; 

•    qualification in one or more of the following key skills:

o    Test & Inspection City & Guilds 2394/5

o    British Standard (BS7671) for Electrical Installation (17th Edition)

o    Fibre Optic termination and testing

o    Fibre Glassing

o    Working at height

o    Soldering & Crimping 

o    Welding

Additional Information 

•    SECURITY – All candidates must be in a position to obtain UK security clearance to SC level. Additional restrictions may apply on certain defence programmes.

•    All candidates will be required to adhere to STS Defence core values.

title: Surface Mount Operator
description_html:
Working with some high-profile customers within the Military and Aerospace sectors, we have ambitious growth plans over the next 5 years and are looking for enthusiastic team players with a passion in supporting our mission to provide market leading customers with a high technology, high reliability Electronics Manufacturing Services (EMS). Our delivery targets are equally ambitious at 100% on time with zero defects to achieve our Vision to add value to our customers’ business every day. Long-term trusting relationships with our colleagues, customers and suppliers are at the core of what we do.

If you believe we’re a good fit with your own values and have a passion for being part of our future success, we would love to hear from you. We invest in our people with training and coaching helping every individual achieve their potential. If you are interested in joining a business that strives to be the best in People Excellence, with comprehensive benefits and career opportunities please apply below.

Job Purpose:

To carry out manufacturing process steps for the assembly of Printed Circuit Boards (PCBs) and assemble product to agreed quality levels to meet customer expectations

Responsibilities:

  • Set-up and run SMT lines to specified efficiency and process quality levels
  • Ensure product meets IPC 610 to the specified class
  • Input and preparation of process control documentation including first off inspection
  • Ensure you are familiar with the department’s output production targets
  • Complete all necessary paperwork and update databases to meet the requirements of the quality management system
  • Ensure compliance with all associated procedures applicable to the manufacturing process
  • Maintain to the highest-level workmanship and product standards, and ensure no scrap is created with minimal re-work outside of design

Person Specification:

  • Professional mannerwith excellent internal customer service skills
  • Good understanding of English including verbal and written communication skills
  • Reliable and strives for high quality standards
  • Accurate with good manual dexterity
  • Desire to learn and develop
  • Interest in electronics / manufacturing

Previous experience:

Essential:

  • Experience of running pick and place machines, using MyData, Dek, Jet printer, SPI, and reflow ovens
  • Good component recognition skills

Preferred:

  • Previous experience of package creation


At Axis we expect every employee to commit to our Teamship Rules:

Caring: for each other, our customers, our suppliers and all other stakeholders

Hardworking: with diligence, creativity, and by going the extra mile

Integrity: through honesty with oneself and with others

Positivity: a can do attitude

Synergy: a united front as team Axis


Working Hours - (39 hrs P/W) Mon - Thurs: 07:30 - 16:30, Fri: 07:30 - 12:30.

Overtime opportunities are available.

Salary - Dependant on Experience

title: Buyer
description_html:
The Buyer will be an integral part of the Procurement team and will support the Procurement Manager to source and manage a varied group of engineering components at the best possible price, delivery and quality, including the identification and conversion of requirements from BoMs.  You will support the Procurement Manager in making improvements in purchasing processes which will ensure efficiencies are met within the business.


Duties:  The Buyer will be responsible for:

•    Requesting for quotations.

•    Raising purchase orders and producing Purchase Order numbers.

•    Leading negotiations with suppliers to achieve cost reductions. 

•    Maintaining and developing relationships with supply base.

•    Ensuring that parts and materials are bought at the most competitive price and delivered on time with no compromise to quality.

•    Identifying new suppliers and negotiating to improve payment terms and supplier agreements and where appropriate to reduce and streamline non-performing suppliers.

•    Resolving invoice queries with accounts team.

•    Supporting the Procurement Co-ordinator in developing all core key suppliers and maintain supplier KPI’s in accordance to the Procurement Co-ordinator direction. 

•    Supporting and working closely with Engineering and Design department on new projects and new concepts. OR working closely with other Stakeholders within engineering services and assisting with materials estimating.

•    Analysing quotations and selecting suppliers.

•    Oversee goods to be returned and monitor for credits.

•    Communicate with accounts about normal costs, credits, new and existing suppliers.

•    Continually improving purchasing methods and driving down external spend.

•    Product Safety Training


Skills/Qualifications: Buyer should have:

•    Confident negotiator with excellent communication skills, both written and oral.

•    A minimum of CIPS level 3.

•    Competent in the use of Sage 200, MS Excel, MS PowerPoint and MS Word. 

•    Proven purchasing experience within an engineering/manufacturing environment.

•    Ability to organise and prioritise workloads, with strong attention to detail.

•    Ability to independently problem solve and make decisions.

•    Have the ability to work well within a team.

title: Quality Inspector
description_html:
It is a great time to join us as we continue to develop and deliver new and exciting solutions for the defence / maritime and aerospace sectors, resulting in continued growth year-on-year!

Located in Gosport, we are now looking to expand our team by recruiting a Quality Inspector with experience to support our busy manufacturing operations.  

Bringing to the role your wealth of inspection experience, you can expect to be involved in:


•    Perform detailed visual inspections of PCBs and cable assemblies to identify defects, including misalignments, solder issues, and component placement errors

•    Conducting inspection based activities including problem solving with basic root cause analysis

•    Carrying out dimension inspection, interrogating data and drawings to make sure they are correct and flagging up any major issues

•    Record and report inspection results, noting any defects or areas for improvement. Maintain accurate records of inspections and test results

•    Ensure all inspected PCBs comply with industry standards (e.g., IPC-A-610,620) and customer-specific requirements

•    Ensure inspection tools and equipment are properly maintained and calibrated.


This is set to be a varied role, and will suit someone who prides themselves on their ability to take a flexible and adaptable approach to their day-to-day operations. It is also a rare opportunity where you can comfortably develop your existing skill set while also learning new skills on the job too, and with an excellent training and development programme in place, you are sure to excel in the role! 


To succeed, we are looking for the following in you:

•    The ability to gain SC clearance (essential security requirement) 

•    Possess a qualification in an Engineering discipline at HND/ HNC level or to an equivalent standard of education, or an Apprenticeship. In lieu of academics, extensive experience will be considered.

•    Experience gained in a similar position where you have operated in a low to medium volume production environment, ideally within the aerospace and / or defence sector(s)

•    Effective product verification techniques, understanding of first article inspection requirements and techniques

•    Experience of managing a ‘first article inspection’ (FAI) process

•    Proven and demonstrable experience in Root Cause analysis, problem solving and dimensional inspection analysis to drawings

•    Be highly proficient in reviewing drawings, 3D CAD and product data management, to clarify parts and product are with customer’s specified tolerances

•    Have hands-on experience of working in a manufacturing environment specialising in the production of fabricated enclosures and products with electronics content

•    Possess strong knowledge of common engineering materials and properties

•    Be knowledgeable in both AS9100 and AS9102 standards 

•    Experience in using MRP system to extract appropriate documentation required for FAIR evidence

•    Have the ability to demonstrate effective communication skills with stakeholders at all levels 

•    Ability to work in a team environment and participate in all team activities, with a willingness to share own professional experience and skills.
description_text:
It is a great time to join us as we continue to develop and deliver new and exciting solutions for the defence / maritime and aerospace sectors, resulting in continued growth year-on-year!
Located in Gosport, we are now looking to expand our team by recruiting a Quality Inspector with experience to support our busy manufacturing operations.
Bringing to the role your wealth of inspection experience, you can expect to be involved in:
•
Perform detailed visual inspections of PCBs and cable assemblies to identify defects, including misalignments, solder issues, and component placement errors
•
Conducting inspection based activities including problem solving with basic root cause analysis
•
Carrying out dimension inspection, interrogating data and drawings to make sure they are correct and flagging up any major issues
•
Record and report inspection results, noting any defects or areas for improvement. Maintain accurate records of inspections and test results
•
Ensure all inspected PCBs comply with industry standards (e.g., IPC-A-610,620) and customer-specific requirements
•
Ensure inspection tools and equipment are properly maintained and calibrated.
This is set to be a varied role, and will suit someone who prides themselves on their ability to take a flexible and adaptable approach to their day-to-day operations. It is also a rare opportunity where you can comfortably develop your existing skill set while also learning new skills on the job too, and with an excellent training and development programme in place, you are sure to excel in the role!
To succeed, we are looking for the following in you:
•
The ability to gain SC clearance (essential security requirement)
•
Possess a qualification in an Engineering discipline at HND/ HNC level or to an equivalent standard of education, or an Apprenticeship. In lieu of academics, extensive experience will be considered.
•
Experience gained in a similar position where you have operated in a low to medium volume production environment, ideally within the aerospace and / or defence sector(s)
•
Effective product verification techniques, understanding of first article inspection requirements and techniques
•
Experience of managing a ‘first article inspection’ (FAI) process
•
Proven and demonstrable experience in Root Cause analysis, problem solving and dimensional inspection analysis to drawings
•
Be highly proficient in reviewing drawings, 3D CAD and product data management, to clarify parts and product are with customer’s specified tolerances
•
Have hands-on experience of working in a manufacturing environment specialising in the production of fabricated enclosures and products with electronics content
•
Possess strong knowledge of common engineering materials and properties
•
Be knowledgeable in both AS9100 and AS9102 standards
•
Experience in using MRP system to extract appropriate documentation required for FAIR evidence
•
Have the ability to demonstrate effective communication skills with stakeholders at all levels
•
Ability to work in a team environment and participate in all team activities, with a willingness to share own professional experience and skills.

title: Mechanics Strategic-Sourcing
description_html:
We are seeking an experienced and high negotiation skilled Strategic - Sourcing to join our team. As a Mechanics Strategic-Sourcing, you will play a crucial role in identifying new suppliers, negotiating price and contracts with them.

Job responsibilities :

  • Identify and research reliable suppliers for various mechanical parts
  • Evaluate potential suppliers based on quality, cost, delivery, risk and other key performance indicators (KPIs)
  • Negotiate pricing and contracts with suppliers to secure favorable terms
  • Participate in supplier process audits together with Quality Department to ensure adherence to quality standards
  • Assist in the development and testing of prototypes, providing feedback on mechanical design and performance
  • Contribute to design for manufacturability (DFM) efforts to optimize part design for efficient and cost-effective production

Other Responsibilities: 

Documentation: 

  • Maintain accurate records of parts, suppliers and quality control activities

Technical Support: 

  • Provide technical support to other teams on mechanical parts and related issues 

Continuous Improvement: 

  • Identify opportunities for cost reduction, quality improvement, and process optimization related to mechanical parts


Output:

  • Contributes to creating a solid base of mechanical suppliers, capable to serve the Cicor core markets – Industrial, Medical and Aerospace & Defense
  • Supplier quality and delivery performance
  • PPV savings & competitiveness


Education and experience:

  • 5+ years in a similar position – Mechanics Strategic Sourcing

 Technical Knowledge: Strong understanding of mechanical engineering principles, materials, and manufacturing processes

  • Experience in the NPI process and familiarity with working with individual and international teams
  • A solid network of mechanical suppliers, which allows a rapid introduction of new suppliers suitable for Cicor

Supplier Management: Sound strategic and operational sourcing experience as well as supplier development in a global supplier base; 

  • Demonstrated work experience on category management

Quality Control: Familiarity with quality control procedures and standards  


Desired profile:

  • Collaborative member who puts the success of the team first
  • Strong team player with high energy level and perseverance to exceed goals
  • Driven to achieve sourcing objectives
  • Solution-oriented
  • Ability to take a structured approach and prioritize in a complex environment
  • Excellent communication and interpersonal skills for effective collaboration with various teams. 
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills to address technical challenges. 
  • Meticulous attention to detail is crucial for ensuring accuracy in part specifications and quality control 
  • Higher education in Mechanics

Specific skills:

  • Negotiation skills
  • Mechanical industry knowledge

Language skills:

  • English – business fluent (C1, C2)
  • Optional: German, French

title: Solderer
description_html:
Are you skilled in soldering and passionate about producing high-quality work? Join our friendly and professional team in the Finishing Cell, where precision and teamwork come together to deliver excellence. We’re looking for someone with experience in electronic assembly and soldering to IPC Class 3 standards, who enjoys working in a fast-paced environment and takes pride in doing things right the first time. 

Key Responsibilities:

  • Soldering a variety of products, including SMT and PTH components, wires, and thermal planes using a variety of equipment.
  • Following detailed assembly instructions and build standards.
  • Performing hand cleaning, fitting mechanical fixings, and maintaining a clean and safe work area.
  • Completing paperwork for traceability such as batch records, build reports, and logs.
  • Collaborate with quality control and engineering teams to identify and correct errors ensuring no scrap is created.
  • Attending team meetings and contributing ideas to improve processes.
  • Maintaining tools and equipment, including microscopes and soldering irons.
  • Ensuring compliance with Health & Safety guidelines and follow ESD requirement.
  • Maintain a clean and organised work area.
  • Working flexibly to help meet weekly production targets.

Person Specification

  • Minimum 12 months experience in soldering of electronic printed circuit boards and currently certified to IPC 610 or J-STD.
  • Knowledge of high critical soldering skills. 
  • Skilled in SMT rework, multi-layer/PTH hand soldering, and wire modifications.
  • Strong hand-eye coordination and attention to detail. 
  • Good understanding of English including verbal and written communication skills
  • Able to work efficiently ensuring accuracy to a high level of throughput.
  • Professional attitude with strong communication skills.
  • A team player who can also work independently and take initiative.

 

At Axis we expect every employee to commit to our Teamship Rules:

Caring: for each other, our customers, our suppliers and all other stakeholders

Hardworking: with diligence, creativity, and by going the extra mile

Integrity: through honesty with oneself and with others

Positivity: a can-do attitude

Synergy: a united front as team Axis

title: Supplier Quality Engineer
description_html:
Are you passionate about ensuring top-tier quality in supply chains? STS Defence is looking for a Supplier Quality Engineer to join our dynamic team in Gosport. This is a fantastic opportunity to play a key role in maintaining and improving supplier performance, ensuring compliance with industry standards, and driving continuous improvement.

 Responsibilities:

  • Product focused assurance activities ensuring compliance to customer requirements. Ensure adherence to specific process controls, certifications and qualifications
  • Facilitate internal non-conformance reports to conclusion using Quality RCA tools such as 8D, Ishikawa etc.
  • Reviewing and approving the company’s release documentation (e.g. CofC, FAIR)
  • Active part of the NPI gated process
  • Conducting supplier audits, appraisals and supplier approvals
  • Assisting and contributing to the Contract Review process
  • Collate KPIs for Business Reviews
  • Champion a culture of continuous improvement, promoting quality awareness and accountability throughout the organisation

Qualifications, Experience and Skills:

  • Lead auditor / internal & supplier auditor
  • Lean Six Sigma Green belt
  • Working knowledge of quality engineering in AS9100 production and project environment
  • Proven and demonstrable ability in problem solving tools and non-conformance management
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills including the ability to provide clear and concise technical communications to internal teams, suppliers and external customers
  • Experience of presenting technical data and root cause/corrective action activities

title: Installation Fitter (Electrical Biased)
description_html:
In this role, you will be responsible for the installation, assembly, and fitting of complex defence systems and components. Working on-site, you will play a key role in ensuring that all systems are installed to the highest standards, ensuring functionality, safety, and compliance with both customer and regulatory requirements. This is a hands-on, field-based position that involves working closely with engineers and project teams to deliver high-quality installations.

Duties:
The Installation Fitter is responsible for:

  • The provision of skilled and generic electrical and/or mechanical fitting work, as directed by the Team Leader
  • Maintaining an awareness of the Time, Cost and Quality criteria of the task in hand
  • Working as a Team member, proactively and efficiently contributing to the main effort
  • Progression through personal continuous improvement, undertaking training as required to improve and sustain high skill levels
  • Ensuring availability for working onsite and offsite, sometimes abroad to CONDO areas – this includes occasional overtime and weekend working
  • Working as directed within other STS Defence departments, providing support where priorities demand

Skills/Qualifications:
The Installation Fitter should have:

  • Proven experience of electrical and mechanical installation
  • A working knowledge of the Health and Safety Act 1974
  • Strong communication and organisational skills
  • The ability to work unsupervised, demonstrate initiative, and be comfortable in a team environment
  • An in-date Passport and category B driving licence
  • Current, relevant electrical qualification and certification
  • Qualification in one or more of the following key skills:
    • Test & Inspection City & Guilds 2391/2392 / 2394-5
    • Mechanical fitting
    • British Standard (BS7671) for Electrical Installation (18th Edition amendment 1)
    • Fibre Optic termination and testing
    • Fibre Glassing
    • Working at height
    • Soldering & Crimping

title: Production Operator - First- Off Inspection
description_html:
Job Purpose: 

The First-Off Inspection operator plays a key role in ensuring product quality at the start of each production batch. This role involves performing detailed inspections of first-off units against engineering drawings, specifications, and quality standards to verify that components meet required criteria before full production is released. The FOI operator acts as a quality gatekeeper, helping to reduce defects, improve process consistency, and ensure customer satisfaction.


Responsibilities:

  • Perform first-off inspections by conducting detailed visual and dimensional checks on the initial unit of each batch.
  • Reference technical drawings, work instructions, and quality standards to verify compliance.
  • Validate component placement, solder quality, torque settings, and any critical or customer-specified features.
  • Accurately complete and maintain inspection records using FOI checklists, batch documentation, or digital quality systems.
  • Communicate inspection results clearly to production teams and escalate non-conformances immediately.
  • Work closely with Quality, Engineering, and Production Team Leaders to resolve issues before batch sign-off.
  • Ensure all inspection activities are traceable and documented in real time to meet audit and regulatory requirements.
  • Support continuous improvement by identifying repeat FOI issues and contributing to corrective actions and quality initiatives.


Person Specification: 

  • Previous experience in manufacturing or quality inspection (electronic/mechanical assembly preferred).
  • Ability to read and interpret technical drawings, specifications, and work instructions.
  • Proficient in the use of hand measurement tools (e.g. calipers, micrometers, gauges).
  • Familiarity with visual inspection criteria for soldering, component alignment, or assembly quality.
  • Strong attention to detail and commitment to high-quality standards.
  • Good verbal and written communication skills.
  • Knowledge of ISO 9001 or other quality management systems is desirable.


At Axis we expect every employee to commit to our Teamship Rules:

 

  • Caring: for each other, our customers, our suppliers and all other stakeholders
  • Hardworking: with diligence, creativity, and by going the extra mile
  • Integrity: through honesty with oneself and with others
  • Positivity: a can do attitude
  • Synergy: a united front as team Axis
